basics.name: Nathan Bergey
basics.label: Programmer
basics.summary: Creative cross-disciplinary web programmer with a passion for outer space. Voracious researcher. Communicates complex ideas with clear explanations and visual analogies.

work.summary: As a very early hire at a small startup I undertook a clean-sheet build for a new product. I was responsible for all aspects of the server infrastructure of a mobile streaming music application. I helped grow the development team from the ground up.
highlights: Designed, implemented, and documented a REST API
Built and managed all product server infrastructure on AWS
Took requirements from front-end developers, designer, and management to develop product

work.position: Program Manager, Lab for Interconnected Devices
work.summary: I transformed the L.I.D. into a full prototyping makerspace at Portland State University. I was the lab's first program manager and oversaw a move in to a larger space and its growth into vital part of the school of engineering.
highlights: Build-out of new lab space, acquisition of new machines and capabilities
Developed lab policies and best practices

work.summary: I was a Freelance software developer in Portland, Oregon. My client work was diverse and included full stack web programming, data visualization, HTML5/JS front end work, and robotics
highlights: Interactive robotics installation for a large technology-focused children's museum
Charts and report design for a small medical device company

work.summary: I was a member of a small group of technology and management consultants working for medium to large corporations
highlights: Balanced many projects and clients simultaneously
Rescued failing projects from other agencies and transformed them into successes

volunteer.summary: PSAS is an open aerospace engineering project. They build innovative ultra-low-cost, open source rockets that feature some of the most sophisticated amateur rocket avionics systems in the world. I spent may years as a principal contributor and key project manager for the group.
highlights: Helped push PSAS into one of the premier aerospace clubs in the world
Made significant contributions in almost all fields e.g: data analysis, software development and management, outreach
Sponsor/director of three computer science senior capstone projects

volunteer.summary: I've both started and contributed to many open source projects.
highlights: Created a public API to NASA Space Station data, currently used worldwide: ~60 million requests per month
Started a collection of D.I.Y. state-of-the-art aerospace simulation resources: <https://open-aerospace.github.io>
